description: Creates a resiliency policy for an application.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: Used for an idempotency token. A client token is a unique, case-sensitive string of up to 64 ASCII characters. You should not reuse the same client token for other API requests. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: The type of resiliency policy to be created, including the recovery time objective (RTO) and recovery point objective (RPO) in seconds. (string) --- (dict) --- Defines a failure policy. Recovery Point Objective (RPO) in seconds. Recovery Time Objective (RTO) in seconds.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags assigned to the resource. A tag is a label that you assign to an Amazon Web Services resource. Each tag consists of a key/value pair. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: tier
parameters.description: The tier for this resiliency policy, ranging from the highest severity ( MissionCritical) to lowest ( NonCritical).

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: Date and time when the resiliency policy was created.

nested_items.name: dataLocationConstraint
nested_items.description: Specifies a high-level geographical location constraint for where your resilience policy data can be stored.

nested_items.name: estimatedCostTier
nested_items.description: Specifies the estimated cost tier of the resiliency policy.

nested_items.name: policyArn
nested_items.description: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resiliency policy. The format for this ARN is: arn: partition:resiliencehub: region: account:resiliency-policy/ policy-id. For more information about ARNs, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) in the Amazon Web Services General Reference guide.

nested_items.name: tier
nested_items.description: The tier for this resiliency policy, ranging from the highest severity ( MissionCritical) to lowest ( NonCritical).
